headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Gilgo Beach Murder Suspect Arrested; Raymond A. Tierney is Interviewed about the Gilgo Beach Case; Carlos Alcaraz is Interviewed about his Wimbledon Win; Fans Welcome Messi to Miami. Aired 6:30-7a ET

utterances.speaker: BRYNN GINGRAS, CNN NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Two other cases, other bodies that were discovered along this same area. And for a man authorities characterized as a demon, they say very possible that there is a link.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) GINGRAS (voice over): More than a decade after serial killings cast fear over Gilgo Beach, Long Island, police now say they have their suspect.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Rex Heuermann is a demon that walks among us. A predator that ruined families.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: Prosecutors charging 59-year-old Rex Heuermann in connection to the case known as the Gilgo Four. Prosecutors say Heuermann murdered three of the women and is a prime suspect in the fourth. In December 2010, the bodies of the four young sex workers were found tied up, wrapped in camouflage burlap, and discovered within days of each other.

utterances.speaker: ANTHONY CARTER, SUFFOLK COUNTY DEPUTY POLICE COMMISSIONER
utterances.sentences: He intended to commit these crimes.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: For years prosecutors say Heuermann was leading a double life.

utterances.speaker: REX HEUERMANN
utterances.sentences: Rex Heuermann, an architect. I'm an architectural consultant. I'm a trouble-shooter. Born and raised on Long Island.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: At his Massapequa Park home, just about 15 miles from the scene of the crimes, life appeared normal for the husband and father of two. But just last year a task force formed to investigate the department's long dormant cases, and they began to zero in on Heuermann.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: There was a very delicate balance between the need of public safety and making the arrest. And that challenge, obviously, it came to a, you know, to a climax in -- on Thursday afternoon. GINGRASwere surveilling him at his Manhattan office. They say he was eating a pizza and discarded it in a public trash can. DNA evidence from the pizza crust matched hairs from a burlap sack one of the bodies were wrapped in. Authorities say they had been trying to match his DNA to other sources without success.

utterances.speaker: RAYMOND TIERNEY, SUFFOLK COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: We had gotten one abandonment sample previously, but the DNA profile was partial.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: Investigators say Heuermann bought burner phones and used fake e-mail accounts to scout the internet for details about the investigation, to search for sex workers and pornography, and even to make taunting calls to the families of victims.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: I can't begin to imagine the pain that these families have had to endure over the last decade.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: Heuermann's attorney says his client pleaded not guilty to the charges.MICHAEL BROWN, REX HEUERMANN'S ATTORNEY: The only thing I can tell you that he did say as he was in tears was, I didn't do this. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: And Heuermann's attorney also says that his client was very distraught when he had a chance to speak with him. It's unclear if he's spoken to authorities.We do know, though, that police are talking to other witnesses, and that includes, Phil, his wife and kids. Phil.

utterances.speaker: PHIL MATTINGLY, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: All right, Brynn Gingras, thank you.

utterances.speaker: ABBY PHILLIP, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: And joining us now is Suffolk County District Attorney Raymond Tierney.District Attorney Tierney, thank you for joining us. I want to ask you some -- about what the Suffolk County Deputy Police Commissioner Anthony Carter told CNN just yesterday, which is that it is possible that there are still more victims out there. Do you share that assessment? RAYMOND A. TIERNEY, SUFFOLK COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY: My opinion doesn't matter. I deal in what I can prove. And right now we're - we can prove - we feel we can prove these three murders. They are allegations at this point, but we're confident with the evidence and we're also confident that we're going to be able to eventually charge that fourth murder.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And what are the strongest pieces of evidence that you have right now that point to Heuermann being the preparator of these crimes?

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: I think we have a description of the last individual who saw the final victim, Amber Costello, alive that matches that of this defendant who has a rather unique physical appearance. We have phone evidence and we also have that DNA evidence. DNA -- the defendant's DNA was recovered off of one of the bodies, whereas his wife's DNA was recovered off of two other - two other - two bodies.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And I want to show folks at home, this is a picture of a belt that was found at the scene here. In January of 2020 police released these images at one of the Gilgo beach crime scenes It had the initials that looked to be "hm" or perhaps "wm."To you believe that that belt belonged to Heuermann?

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, the initials are "hm" or "wh." This last name is Heuermann. And I believe he has relatives with the name of William.

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, we don't disclose sources, but we -- I can tell you that this has been, from the very beginning, since we've gotten on the case, a very comprehensive investigation and we're going to look at every single source of evidence, whether that's a human source or electronic or molecular or whatever.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Has anyone else come forward with information about Heuermann or about these cases since this arrest was announced on Friday?

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, the one thing about arrest, obviously it brings a lot of attention. The other thing is, we have executed a number of search warrants. So, right now, we have a flood of information and a flood of evidence coming in and it's going to take us a while to sort of go through all of that.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And so far, as we were just discussing, Heuermann's been charged with three of these killings on Gilgo Beach. When do you think you'll have enough evidence to go forward with actually charging him with that fourth killing?

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: We're going to continue to work through the grand jury process as we've doing. You know, we arrested him last Thursday out of concern for both the integrity of our investigation, as well as the safety of the community. But that investigation is continuing with regard to Maureen Brainard-Barnes, and, you know, we feel confident that we're going to be able to eventually charge that murder, but we're not going to put a time frame on it.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Do you think that this will get to trial soon? What's the timeline for a trial here?

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, it's an interesting case because you're talking about something that is 13 years in the making. So, when you talk about the unbelievable amount of material that was there prior to me assuming office in January of '22, and then you also have over 300 search warrants and judicial requests. So, there is a tremendous amount of information, which, obviously, you know, the defense is going to want to look at.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: A very difficult and troubling case.Raymond Tierney, thank you for giving us all of those updates.

utterances.speaker: TIERNEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And coming up next for us, a stunner at Wimbledon.(VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: That collapse on the court signaling a new era in tennis is here. Carlos Alcaraz, just 20 years old, winning his second grand slam title after beating Novak Djokovic. Widely considered one of the greatest in tennis history, in a thrilling five-set Wimbledon final yesterday.Now, Carlitos, as he's now, showed off his dazzling athleticism as he outran and outhit Djokovic, who was going for his eighth Wimbledon title, his fifth in a row. The match played before royalty, and American royalty, Brad Pitt. It lasted nearly five hours and signaling a changing of the guard in the men's game.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: The 36-year-old Djokovic smashing his racket on the net after Alcaraz broke his serve early in the final set. The Spanish sensation is now the first man not named Roger Federer or Rafael Nadal or Novak Djokovic or Andy Murray to lift the trophy at the all-England club since 2002. Djokovic, who sits at 23 grand slam titles says that he has never played someone quite like Alcaraz.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) NOVAK DJOKOVIC, 23-GRAND SLAM CHAMPION: People have been talking in the past 12 months or so about his game being -- consisting of certain elements from Roger, Raf and myself. I would agree with that. I think he -- he's got basically the best of all three worlds. (END VIDEO CLIP) PHILLIP: And joining us now is the 2023 Wimbledon champion, Carlos Alcaraz. Carlos, thank you for joining us. CARLOS ALCARAZ, 2023 WIMBLEDON CHAMPION: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And how are you feeling this morning now that you have officially been crowned -- let me look my notes here -- the new king of centre court?

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Well, (INAUDIBLE), honestly, but you know, I still can't believe it. It's a dream for me. But I have to win many, many more, you know, to consider myself a new king of centre court.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You know, Carlos, one of the things -- Djokovic made a really good point, people have been talking about you, your game and you being the future for a while now. And, obviously, you have one major already before Wimbledon. When you were - when you lost the first set 1-6, admittedly, as a viewer, I thought, oh, all right, not quite yet. What was going through your head after that first set?

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Well, I thought - honest, I thought, please, don't be at this spot. You know, place - you know, the play a little bit more better, to, you know, be close in the match and entertain the more the people in this final. But at the - but at the same time, you know, I know that he was going to - to have my chances. You know, he tried to stay there, you know, to the opportunities that I - that I had to -- and, you know, I believe in myself all the time. I knew that I was playing great, I was playing good. So, it's about timing, you know, to have more opportunities.

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Well, I learned a lot from that match, you know. Yesterday was totally different. You know, I prepared mentally totally from before the match. And, you know, during the match I dealt with the pressure so much better than I did during French Open. It was just about mentally, you know. I know that basically I am - I'm really well I'm prepared to play this kind of match, the kind of marathon. You know, and, you know, it - and, yes, it was totally, totally different. You know, I'm really, really proud to be able to play at this level, you know, five hours against a legend. And, you know, it's something that, yes, I -- I learned a lot from the French Open.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You know, Carlos, I think you had the entire crowd at centre court cracking up after when you were talking about the -- kind of the generation generational differences between yourself and Novak Djokovic. I guess my question after yesterday is, do you feel like the changing of the guard has officially happened?

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Sorry, say it again.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Do you feel like there's been a changing of the guard? Are you the new kind of - the new face of professional tennis after decades of Djokovic and Federer and Nadal. Now it's -- it's your time.

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Well, it's a big world, you know. I don't know. Honestly, I don't know. I hope, you know, that the people say that, you know, but Djokovic is still there. Rafa as well. I mean, let's talk about it, you know, in - you know, in some years ahead. So, in the future we can talk about it but right now I think - I think it's not - it's not the right moment.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Well, Carlos, we love that you're here with us this morning. Can you show us the trophy real quick before you go?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Yes, what's - what's to your - what's to your left?

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: That looks like something. There it is. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Oh, wait, wait, wait, don't drop it.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's awesome.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: All right. We love

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: That's awesome. Congratulations. Carlos Alcaraz, we appreciate your time, my friend. Enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: ALCARAZ
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: All right, well, new overnight, Ukraine attacks a crucial bridge connecting Russia to the Crimean peninsula. Ukraine intelligence officials say the damage will hurt Russia's ability to move supplies for its war in Ukraine. New details just coming into CNN.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I would like to introduce to you, your number 10, Inter Miami number 10, America's number 10, the best number 10 in the world, Lionel Andres Messi.(END VIDEO CLIP) PHILLIP: Thousands of fans packing into Inter Miami's stadium last night to welcome soccer superstar Lionel Messi to Miami. Messi officially signed on with the Major League Soccer team on Saturday after weeks of anticipation. But the big unveiling also came with some major technical issues and a lot of rain, but that put (ph) a damper on some of the excitement. But CNN's Carlos Suarez is live for us in Fort Lauderdale this morning. So, Carlos, a little rain in South Florida. Not exactly the most surprising thing. But there were a lot of technical issues with the production last night.

utterances.speaker: SUAREZ
utterances.sentences: And right here really tells the story, Miami is all about Lionel Messi. He's been in town for about a week now and there's been a great deal of frenzy with him moving around the city. Social media was abuzz after the player did some grocery shopping with his family. And folks saw him just out with his family picking up some groceries. There was also a lot of hoopla on social media after he went out to have an Italian dinner with his family.Again, Abby and Phil, everything is about Lionel Messi in south Florida as the city here gets ready for his big debut. Friday night, again, tickets are going for about $500 apiece. Those are the cheap seats. The most expensive one on StubHub right now is going for about $4,000, guys.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: I just love that he's doing his own grocery shopping.Carlos Suarez, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Well, the DeSantis campaign burning through cash and hitting some roadblocks. We have new reporting on some of the strategic shifts they're considering.
